big_picture_notes: Ephesians is architected in two movements marked by the ‘walk’ motif: chs. 1–3 set the indicative (who we are in Christ) and chs. 4–6 set the imperative (how we walk in Christ). Literary glue includes the pervasive ‘in Christ/in him’ anaphora, the unity theme (Jew/Gentile; one body/one Spirit/one hope…), and macro‑syntax such as the single doxological sentence (1:3–14). The structure insists that ethics flow from theology: heavenly blessing → corporate reconciliation → unified conduct and spiritual warfare.

stories.story_title: The Eternal Plan: Union, Riches, and Resurrection Power
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (1:1) epistolary salutation opens the letter; end (2:22) completes the new‑temple metaphor (‘dwelling place of God in the Spirit’), capping the corporate identity argument. Glue: ‘in Christ’ leitwort and ‘riches’ vocabulary tie election, redemption, inheritance, and life together.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Starts with apostolic identification; ends with grace/peace benediction. Devices: epistolary salutatio/benedictio, theme preview (grace/peace).
Begins ‘Blessed be…’; ends ‘to the praise of his glory’ (Spirit’s seal). Devices: doxological anaphora ‘in him’, triune blessing, macro‑sentence parataxis.
‘For this reason…’ thanks→petition; ends with Christ as head over all for the church. Devices: thanksgiving→supplication structure, resurrection/exaltation power focus.
‘You were dead…’ contrasts past death with present co‑vivification/seating; ends with purpose of displaying immeasurable grace. Devices: stark antithesis, purpose clause teleology.
‘For by grace… through faith’ explains 2:1–7; ends with created for good works to walk in. Devices: justification mini‑summary, works‑purpose closure.
‘Therefore remember…’ recounts alienation→peace; ends with shared access in one Spirit to the Father. Devices: dividing‑wall metaphor, repetition of ‘peace’, one‑new‑man creation.

scenes.scene_name: The Church as God’s New Temple
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: ‘So then…’ logical conclusion; ends with dwelling place of God. Devices: architectural metaphor (foundation/cornerstone/temple), corporate identity resolution.

stories.story_title: The Revelation of the Mystery and the Body’s Unity
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (3:1) parenthetical commission digression; end (4:16) body growth in love completes unity/gifts argument before broader ethics. Glue: ‘mystery’ terminology (3:3–9) and the sevenfold ‘one’ (4:4–6) bridging doctrine to unity appeal.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: ‘For this reason I…’ prisoner‑apostle; ends with becoming a minister by grace/power. Devices: revelation source, Gentiles as fellow heirs (3:6).
Least of saints given grace to unveil wisdom to rulers; ends with bold access and exhortation not to lose heart. Devices: self‑abasement vs cosmic scope, teleology of suffering.
Resumes ‘for this reason’; ends with doxology. Devices: dimensional love (breadth/length/height/depth), superabundant ability formula.
‘I… urge you to walk’ hinge from indicative→imperative; ends with ‘one…’ heptad. Devices: ‘walk’ structural marker, anaphoric ‘one’ list.

scenes.scene_name: Diversity of Gifts from the Ascended Christ
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Grace to each; Ps 68 descent/ascent; ends ‘that he might fill all things’. Devices: proof‑text interlude, triumph imagery.
Given ministers to equip until maturity; ends with body building itself in love. Devices: body‑under‑Head metaphor, infancy→maturity contrast.

stories.story_title: The New Walk in the World and Spiritual Warfare
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (4:17) ‘no longer walk’ launches imperative section; end (6:24) benediction closes epistle. Glue: repeated ‘walk’ (4:17; 5:2, 8, 15), old/new self clothing metaphor, Haustafel sequence, and armor of God imagery.

scenes.scene_name: Old Self Off, New Self On
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: No longer walk as Gentiles; ends with putting on the new self. Devices: clothing metaphor, mind renewal, identity contrast.
Therefore… series of imperatives; ends ‘as God in Christ forgave you’. Devices: paratactic ethic list, gospel grounding.
Imitate God; walk in love; ends ‘do not become partners’. Devices: love motif, vice boundary for kingdom inheritance.
You were darkness, now light; ends with hymn/quotation ‘awake…’. Devices: light/dark antithesis, identity→imperative logic.
Walk wisely; be filled with the Spirit; ends with mutual submission. Devices: folly/wisdom contrast, worship/thanskgiving outputs, submission hinge.
Wives submit; husbands love; Christ‑church analogy; ends with dual summary command. Devices: extended marriage analogy, head/body motif.
Children obey; fathers nurture; slaves obey; masters do the same; ends with reward rationale. Devices: balanced reciprocal duties, Lord‑centric motivation.
Be strong; put on panoplia; ends with sword of the Spirit. Devices: sustained military metaphor, listed armor pieces with theological functions.
All‑times prayer; Tychicus’ mission; peace and grace benedictions. Devices: prayer linkage to warfare, epistolary close.
